level.text: Each provider shall ensure that residents are weaned from the ventilator when weaning is determined to be medically appropriate.
A provider shall discontinue weaning and resume mechanical ventilation if the resident experiences any of the following:
Blood pressure elevation of more than 20 mmHg Systolic or more than 10 mmHg diastolic;
Heart rate of more than 10% above the baseline or a heart rate of 120 beats per minute;
Respiratory rate increase of more than 10 breaths per minute or a rate above 30 breaths per minute;
Arrhythmias;
Reduced tidal volume;
Elevated partial pressure of arterial carbon dioxide;
Extreme anxiety;
Dyspnea; or
Accessory muscle use in breathing or an otherwise deteriorating breathing pattern.
Each nursing facility shall have an appropriate program for discharge and weaning from the ventilator.

The nursing facility shall ensure that the resident and all caregivers be trained in all aspects of mechanical ventilation and demonstrate proficiency in ventilator care techniques before a ventilator-dependent resident can be discharged home on a mechanical ventilator.
The physician and respiratory team shall arrange a schedule for follow-up visits, as indicated by the needs of the resident.
A written discharge plan shall be provided to and reviewed with the resident and resident’s caregiver and shall include at a minimum the following information:
Name, address and telephone number of the primary physician;
Address and telephone number of the local hospital emergency department;
Name, address and telephone number of the physician for regular respiratory check-ups, if different from the physician identified in 6510.4(a);
The responsibilities of the resident and caregiver in daily ventilator care;
Identification of financial resources for long-term care;
Identification of community resources for health, social, educational and vocational needs;
An itemized list of all equipment and supplies needed for mechanical ventilation;
Names, addresses and telephone numbers of mechanical ventilation equipment dealers and a list of services that they provide; and
Contingency plans for emergency situations.
The nursing facility shall notify MAA of the date of discharge from the facility.
